content.description: A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in means will be conducted to investigate whether the average length of a cell phone call is shorter this year compared with 5 years ago. From a random sample of 35 phone call records this year, the average length was 25 minutes with a standard deviation of 4 minutes. From a random sample of 32 phone call records from 5 years ago, the average length was 27 minutes with a standard deviation of 5 minutes. The difference (this year minus five years ago) in means will be calculated.
content.question: With a null hypothesis of no difference in length, which of the following is a correct test statistic for the test?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 25 minus 27, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4 squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 5 squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>27</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 25 minus 27, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>27</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 25 minus 27, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4 squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, end root, plus the square root of the fraction with numerator 5 squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>27</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 27 minus 25, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4 squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 5 squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>27</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 27 minus 25, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>27</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 25 minus 27, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 4 squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 5 squared, and denominator 32, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>27</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
